info.title: IdentitySvc API
info.description: Vendor-agnostic identity facade over Azure AD B2C, Auth0, Okta, or Keycloak.

get.description: Returns an authorization URL (and PKCE challenge when applicable) that the client can use to redirect the user to the upstream identity provider.

parameters.name: pkce
parameters.description: Explicitly enable or disable PKCE for this request (overrides default behavior).

parameters.name: client_type
parameters.description: Hint used to infer PKCE behavior. Common values: 'spa', 'native', 'server'.

uses_pkce.description: Echo of the resolved PKCE decision for this request

get.description: Exchanges the authorization code for tokens. If PKCE was used for this 'state', the stored verifier is automatically applied.

post.description: Use a refresh token to obtain a fresh access token (and optionally new refresh/id tokens).

get.description: Returns the normalized user profile for the bearer access token supplied in the Authorization header.

post.description: Performs local logout (stateless). Returns 204. The client should also sign out from the upstream identity provider if desired.

get.summary: Get OpenID configuration for the tenant

accountEnable.description: Set false to disable the user

get.description: Pass-through to Microsoft Graph with a filter 'mail eq {email}'.

patch.summary: Update a user's email sign-in identity
Update identities and password profile for a user

post.summary: Close Excel workbook session for drive item

delete.summary: Delete phone authentication methods (all or by methodId)
Delete email authentication methods (all or by methodId)

post.summary: Reset password via specified auth method
Get Azure AD B2C Graph access token (client credentials)

200.description: Generic eligibility without revealing account existence

post.summary: Admin: Check if email exists and if user is active

accessToken.description: Access token issued by the identity provider

refreshToken.description: Refresh token that can be used to obtain new access tokens

expiresIn.description: Lifetime of the access token in seconds

tokenType.description: Token type as reported by the provider

accountEnable.description: Set false to disable the user
